product_name: GarnierSkinActive Micellar Cleansing Water All-in-1 Mattifying
summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeVeganSustainable PackagingSkinActive Micellar Cleansing Water All-in-1 Mattifying gently cleanses skin and removes makeup, all in 1 step. Leaves skin with matte & natural finish.
details: DetailsBenefitsThis micellar water and makeup remover for oily skin cleanses, removes makeup and purifies poresMicellar water is oil-free, paraben-free, fragrance-free, sulfate-free and silicone-freeMicellar water can be used as an eye makeup removerNo-rinse makeup remover cleanses skinNo harsh rubbingFeaturesOil-free, Paraben-free, Silicone-free, Sulfate-freeItem 2503149How To UseSaturate a cotton pad. To remove eye makeup: Hold pad over closed eyes for a few seconds, then gently wipe away without harsh rubbing.To cleanse skin and remove face makeup: Gently wipe pad all over until skin is completely clean from makeup and impurities. Use daily, AM/PM. No need to rinse.Precautions: Avoid getting in eyes. Rinse eyes thoroughly if contact occurs.IngredientsAqua/Water, Hexylene Glycol, Glycerin, Alcohol Denat., Poloxamer 184, Polyaminopropyl Biguanide, Disodium Cocoamphodiacetate, Disodium Edta. F.I.L.# B172461/1.
how_to_use: Saturate a cotton pad. To remove eye makeup: Hold pad over closed eyes for a few seconds, then gently wipe away without harsh rubbing.To cleanse skin and remove face makeup: Gently wipe pad all over until skin is completely clean from makeup and impurities. Use daily, AM/PM. No need to rinse.Precautions: Avoid getting in eyes. Rinse eyes thoroughly if contact occurs.

reviews.headline: Definitely recommend
reviews.comments: If u need something thats not harsh and keeps ur skin hydrated then u should get this because i have been using it and it 100% works and i love it!

reviews.headline: Please sell a larger size bottle
reviews.comments: This is a great makeup remover for oily skin. Minimal to no breakout if I don't use a facial cleanser after removing my foundation.

reviews.headline: I Love This Micellar Water for Oilier Skin
reviews.comments: I first tried the original Micellar Water (Pink cap) and thought it was okay. I just discovered the Mattifying formula and found that it is superior for combination to oily skin. Hopefully it will be available in the 23-ounce size.

reviews.headline: NEVER!
reviews.comments: I used this product while at a friends house and it is awful. I don't even have that sensitive of skin and it turned my face bright red like I had a bunch of zits. I will never use this again. And I was so disappointed because I needed a way for my to easily take of my makeup because I am lazy. It didn't even work that well. It also made my skin dry, so I had to put on bunches of my moisturizers and waste them because this stupid product turned me red and dried my skin in the first use!!!!!!

reviews.headline: Not for redheads
reviews.comments: I borrowed this cleansing water from a friend and it was fine for about 30 seconds. After that, my skin turned bright red and burned. I looked like I had zits everywhere. I will not be buying this again. All of my other fellow redheads also turned red in the face when they used it too.

reviews.headline: Fantastic Product
reviews.comments: So much better than makeup wipes. Will not burn eyes when taking off eye makeup and light enough that it does not bother surrounding skin. Will repurchase and may even try the other versions of this product.

reviews.headline: Great Product
reviews.comments: I use this to remove my makeup before bedtime and its great. I do have oily skin so it helps and doesn't dry my skin at all. Its not harsh, it's gentle. It's also acne safe, it does not contain any pore clogging ingredients.

reviews.headline: No.
reviews.comments: It doesn't work for me.

reviews.headline: Yes, I would recommend
reviews.comments: Really like it

reviews.headline: Daughters favorite cleaner
reviews.comments: This is my daughters favorite face cleaner she used so far. She breaks out easily and the only other cleaner that has worked well for her is Clinique and this is half the price for much more, so I hope it is still working after 30 days.

reviews.headline: Perfect for oily and acne prone skin!
reviews.comments: I stopped using makeup remover wipes because they would irritate my skin but this does not! It takes all  my makeup off even my eye makeup. Makes me feel so clean and doesn't make my acne worse.

reviews.headline: Is there a difference?
reviews.comments: I use Garnier's original micellar water all the time and have been for a long time but then I saw this version of it, which, in theory should be perfect for an oily skinned person like me but I honestly cannot tell if there was any difference in my matteness with using this version compared to the original one. So, maybe that, right there, means there wasn't/isn't. It's still a great overall micellar water for what a regular micellar water is supposed to do.

reviews.headline: Cleanses well
reviews.comments: Paying for "cleansing water" sounded pretty silly until I tried this. I splash it on a reusable cloth cleansing pad, and it does get my face nice and clean. I haven't really put the "mattifying" claim to the test.

reviews.headline: So impressed
reviews.comments:
I live in hot, humid NE Florida and I've tried all the expensive mattifying moisturizers, primers, finishing sprays etc etc.
Nothing has kept my face shine free the way this product has. I am a lifer.

reviews.headline: Great makeup remover
reviews.comments: Amazing makeup remover. i switched from the makeup wipes to this and my skin is 10x clearer. this is a great alternative to makeup wipes.

reviews.headline: Love it
reviews.comments: I use this one & the blue waterproof micellar water. I have acne prone skin & I tend to get oily. Doesn't break me out & removes makeup fairly well. I normally use this for my eye makeup & use wipes for my face. No allergic reactions or anything

reviews.headline: Horrible product!
reviews.comments: I have really oily skin and I figured that this would help me not only remove my makeup but also remove the oils. Absolutely wrong! First it didn't even help to remove my makeup! Second it completely stripped my skin and caused an allergic reaction to my eyes. I had scabs on my libs for a few days. I couldn't even put anything on them to help heal because it burned so much! I went back to the waterproof cleanser instead. Would never recommend this to anyone.

reviews.headline: Deserves to be in a value size!!
reviews.comments: Holy grail product right here! Been using for years, not too drying for oily skin and removes make-up soooo well. I go through this too fast though, this deserves a value size also!

reviews.headline: It works well
reviews.comments: I like this. It works a little better than some other miceller waters I've tried probably due to it being mattifying. They all say you don't need to rinse them off but some I've definitely needed to for a cleaner feeling. What I don't like is that the top leaks once I turn it right side up. I have product running down the side of the bottle every time I use it. It's wasteful and super messy. I'm not going to buy this again until the bottle is changed, but I still liked it.

reviews.headline: Takes make up off easily
reviews.comments: Nice, sticky but not so abrasive to the skin! Would recommend!

faceoff_positive.comments:
As a combination-type skin gal, my face can easily break out or clog up with gross blackheads. About 2years ago I began getting regular facials & altered my diet (no more soy) to help with various issues. It was then that my facialist (sorry, not a word, but I don't know how to spell that profession that begins with the letter 'A' and ends with letters 'IST) informed me that today's facial cleaners are not formulated to remove all dirt, makeup and impurities and strongly suggested the addition of makeup remover and/or micellar water to my face cleaning routine. I researched products online in search of a good micellar water fit for combo skin. The Garnier micellar water (green top) effectively removes most of my face makeup in the evening. I follow up with a general deep cleaning face wash (I use a general acne wash in the morning) and know that my face is fully cleansed. The micellar does not dry out my skin whatsoever so I can use it as a general quick pick-me-up face cleanse after my gym workout or a few hours after washing my face (prior to running a few quick errands). This is not the best micellar water for removing eye makeup, but it can remove most eyeshadows easily (its the mascara that puts up a fight). I still use general eyemakeup remover regardless.
There is NO greasy feeling/residue on my face after using this brand, unlike several other brands (including Garniers pink topped micellar water).
faceoff_positive.headline: The Mattifying Micellar Is AWESOME!

faceoff_negative.comments: I have used the pink and blue Garnier Micellar Cleansing Waters without any issue for the past year, but the instant I swiped the new All-in-1 Mattifying cleansing water on my face I got a rash on my face.  This has never happened with any other product I've used so I don't think I have overly sensitive skin.  I don't know why this product was so terrible for me.  It has already been four days since the rash first appeared and it is still present--no longer red, but my face has a lot of texture whereas it used to be smooth.  I compared the ingredients and saw there are a few more ingredients in this product than the classic pink lid bottle, so I much be allergic to something in this bottle.  Just be careful if you choose to try this product.
faceoff_negative.headline: Irritated My Skin!

rollup.name: SkinActive Micellar Cleansing Water All-in-1 Mattifying
